title: Martin Luther King, Jr.: "I have a dream"

multiple-choice.question: What was the main purpose of Martin Luther King Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" speech?

options.text: To commemorate the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation

options.label: B
options.text: To call for an end to the Vietnam War

options.label: C
options.text: To advocate for civil rights and racial equality

options.label: D
options.text: To promote economic growth and development

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the 100-year anniversary of the Emancipation Proclamation mentioned in the speech?

options.label: A
options.text: It marked the beginning of the civil rights movement

options.label: B
options.text: It highlighted the progress made in achieving racial equality

options.label: C
options.text: It emphasized the ongoing struggles faced by African Americans

options.label: D
options.text: It celebrated the end of slavery in the United States

options.label: B
options.text: A society where all Americans would be equal and free

options.label: C
options.text: A society where African Americans would be judged by the color of their skin

options.label: D
options.text: A society where the government would have complete control over citizens

options.label: C
options.text: That all Americans would be free and equal one day

options.label: D
options.text: That the government would never address the needs of African Americans

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It was a call to action for the civil rights movement

options.label: C
options.text: It was a statement of the current state of racial equality in the United States

options.label: D
options.text: It was a message of hope and optimism for the future

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It was a commemoration of the end of slavery in the United States

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: A society where the government would have complete control over citizens

options.label: A

title: How sugar affects the brain - Nicole Avena

multiple-choice.question: What happens when sugar enters the mouth?

options.label: A
options.text: It is broken down into glucose and fructose.

options.label: B
options.text: It activates the sweet-taste receptors on the tongue.

options.label: C
options.text: It is absorbed directly into the bloodstream.

options.label: D
options.text: It is excreted from the body immediately.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary neurotransmitter responsible for the brain's reward system?
What happens when sugary foods are consumed too frequently or in large amounts?

options.label: A
options.text: The brain's reward system is activated, leading to a pleasurable experience.

options.label: B
options.text: The brain's reward system is overactivated, leading to loss of control, craving, and increased tolerance to sugar.

options.label: C
options.text: The brain's reward system is deactivated, leading to a decrease in pleasure.

options.label: D
options.text: The brain's reward system is unaffected.

options.label: A
options.text: To regulate the release of insulin.

options.label: B
options.text: To activate the sweet-taste receptors on the tongue.

options.label: C
options.text: To send signals to the brain that the body is full or should produce more insulin.

options.label: D
options.text: To excrete sugar from the body.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to dopamine levels when a food becomes boring?
Why is it important to have a balanced diet that includes a variety of foods?

options.label: A
options.text: To regulate the brain's response to sugary foods.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the risk of overconsumption.

options.label: C
options.text: To decrease the risk of overconsumption.

options.label: D
options.text: To have no effect on the brain's response to sugary foods.

options.label: A
options.text: It is the same as healthy foods.

options.label: B
options.text: It is different from healthy foods.

options.label: C
options.text: It activates the reward system, leading to a pleasurable experience.

options.label: D
options.text: It deactivates the reward system, leading to a decrease in pleasure.

multiple-choice.question: Why do people seem to be hooked on sugary foods?

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are rare among dopamine-inducing foods.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the brain's reward system when a person eats a balanced meal?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect food that's gone bad.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the risk of overconsumption.

options.label: C
options.text: To regulate the brain's response to sugary foods.

options.label: D
options.text: To have no effect on the brain's response to sugary foods.

multiple-choice.question: What is the practice of consuming insects called?

options.label: B
